Description: Head of a figurine of a woman (seated goddess?) with a high polos. Red paint on top of polos. Mould-made and solid. Very micaceous light brown clay. Head fragment.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Parallels from Kamiros, Rhodes (Jacopi 1930, fig. 328, 323; Higgins 1970, nos. 70). Jacopi, G. 1930. Esplorazione archeologica di Camiro I. Clara Rhodos IV. Scavi Nelle Necropoli Camiresi 1929-1930.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DB.041) (Phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5853 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
